intro: Pimpinella eriocarpa var. brevihirta, commonly known as the hairy cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbel-shaped flower clusters and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and woodland edges. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small white flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
